d4505a1a-5fd2-4f0d-8fa4-8ea626f1ee07.description: Earners of this badge successfully created and hosted two websites running on Virtual machines. They implemented load balancing for the Virtual Machines, allowing them to become highly available and preventing the overloading of a single server therefore reducing downtime.
d4505a1a-5fd2-4f0d-8fa4-8ea626f1ee07.name: Azure Load Balancing

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrating the creation of a Virtual Network that contains a NAT Gateway and two Virtual Machines, and creating and consequently testing a Load Balancer to reduce downtime.

a78b6457-8706-41fe-82e6-3f80ad5ace54.description: The learner was able learn the skills to utilize the Azure portal to create an Application Gateway with a Web Application Firewall (WAF). The WAF uses OWASP rules to protect applications. These rules include protection against attacks such as SQL injection, cross-site scripting attacks, and session hijacks. After creating the application gateway, you test it to make sure it is working correctly.
a78b6457-8706-41fe-82e6-3f80ad5ace54.name: Application Gateway with Web Application Firewall

badge_template_activities.title: Create an application gateway with WAF enabled Create the virtual machines used as backend servers Create a storage account and configure diagnostics Test the application gateway

df7f74ab-aff3-4f9f-a6fd-e477dcdf5853.description: Earners of this badge have created an App Service plan and consequently deployed a web app using this plan. They monitored the performance of the web app under a load and then scaled out the app and verified that the performance has improved as a result. The earner of the badge not only learned how to scale out to use multiple instances, but also how to scale up to provision more compute power.
df7f74ab-aff3-4f9f-a6fd-e477dcdf5853.name: App Service Scale Up and Scale Out

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrated the knowledge to create an Azure App Service plan and Web App, and demonstrated the ability to successfully monitor and scale the web app to better handle load.

7a00ec45-d393-43d1-a612-45859bd18fd8.description: The learner has learned the skills required to create and utilize a hub and spoke network topology using Azure Virtual Network Manager. They were able deploy a virtual network gateway in the hub virtual network which allowed resources in the spoke virtual networks to communicate with remote networks using VPN.
7a00ec45-d393-43d1-a612-45859bd18fd8.name: Create a Secured Hub and Spoke Network

badge_template_activities.title: Create multiple virtual networks and deploy a virtual network gateway. Create a hub and spoke network topology followed adding a security configuration blocking traffic on port 80 and 443.

0feb4ab7-eedb-471f-a98a-a7f87eb63f2e.description: Earners of this badge have an ability to implement, manage and monitor identify, governance, storage, compute, and virtual networks in Microsoft Azure. They are able to manage their Azure subscriptions, secure identities, administer infrastructure, configure networking, create and scale virtual machines and manage Azure services.
0feb4ab7-eedb-471f-a98a-a7f87eb63f2e.name: Microsoft Azure Administrator

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the Microsoft Azure Administrator learning path and have demonstrated a comprehensive understanding of administering a range of Microsoft Azure services including compute, virtual networks, subscriptions and storage solutions.

e3adbad8-fe80-481e-8f49-afb74849952e.description: The learner was able to learn how to make use of Azure IoT Central to gather and export telemetry from IoT devices. The learner was also learnt how to use a mobile device to act as an IoT device to stream telemetry to IoT Central. Furthermore, they learnt how to create an application, add rules and actions to the application and finally how to export the telemetry data to Azure Data Explorer, a separate cloud application.
e3adbad8-fe80-481e-8f49-afb74849952e.name: Azure IoT Central Application

badge_template_activities.title: Create an IoT Central application, register a device into the application and connect a device to IoT Central. Create a rule based on telemetry and action Create an Azure Data Explorer instance and configure data for exporting.

5128d6cc-407c-475f-8452-6b7dd55441b7.description: Earners of this badge created an IAM role, simple AD, DHCP, and then launched an active directory server. They also logged in with user credentials and added a computer to the active directory server.
5128d6cc-407c-475f-8452-6b7dd55441b7.name: AWS Directory service

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge demonstrated the ability to create an IAM Role to work with Active Directory, to create a simply AD directory, to create a DHCP option set, to create and configure an Active Directory Server, to launch an active directory server, to login with user credentials, and to add a compute to an active directory server.

51348fd0-9e43-4d98-8986-7aefd7b57e1d.description: Earners of this badge learnt how to work with Terraform to create a VPC and an EC2 instance in AWS. They installed Terraform and created a configuration file to deploy resources to AWS.
51348fd0-9e43-4d98-8986-7aefd7b57e1d.name: AWS resources with Terraform

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge demonstrated knowledge of installing Terraform, configuring Terraform providers, creating resources with Terraform, verifying resource creation and deleting created resources.

f0810abc-70b2-4162-bdd6-11e23badd622.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated that they have a Foundational understanding of AWS services. They are able to identify essential AWS services necessary to set up to AWS projects.
f0810abc-70b2-4162-bdd6-11e23badd622.name: AWS Techincal Essentials

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the AWS Technical Essentials learning path and demonstrated a foundational ability to create, manage and deploy infrastructure in AWS.

8d6d4b8a-aa0b-4199-849c-eae3aa49815e.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the ability to run controlled fault injection experiments against applications by conducting a simple VM Shutdown experiment.
8d6d4b8a-aa0b-4199-849c-eae3aa49815e.name: Azure Chaos Studio

badge_template_activities.title: The learner was able to demonstrate their ability to create a Linux VM using the Azure portal, they were also able to enable Chaos Studio on the VM, and consequently created and run a chaos experiment - Create a Linux Virtual Machine using the Azure portal. - Enable Chaos Studio on the Virtual Machine. - Create an experiment. - Give the experiment permissions to access your Virtual Machine. - Run the experiment.

73983d83-55b6-46c9-966d-9ff733b48b8b.description: The earner of this badge was able to demonstrate their ability to deploy an event grid which allowed them to easily manage events across many different Azure services and applications.
73983d83-55b6-46c9-966d-9ff733b48b8b.name: Azure Event Grid with Blob Storage Events

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge were able to deploy several resources which allowed them to create and configure a Traffic Manager using the geographic traffic routing method.

791ed56e-b3f1-48f5-a9a1-e441f0918265.description: By achieving this badge, the learner was able to demonstrate their ability to create, configure and deploy a RDS Backup Database Snapshots. They were also able to demonstrate how to deploy "point-in-time" snapshots.
791ed56e-b3f1-48f5-a9a1-e441f0918265.name: Backup and restore AWS RDS databases

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge demonstrated knowledge of RDS Database they were able to do this by deploying and connecting to RDS databases, they then created a snapshot and backup; finally, they to connect to a backup database.

bf865a75-ce8c-4562-951c-0669132adfdb.description: Earners of this badge have obtained the ability to execute, identify and protect Cloud environments from Denial-of-Service attacks by identifying vulnerabilities with AWS Simple Storage Service.
bf865a75-ce8c-4562-951c-0669132adfdb.name: Certified Ethical Hacker - Cloud Computing

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the Certified Ethical Hacker - Cloud Computing lab and demonstrated the ability to perform S3 bucket enumeration, exploit misconfigured S3 buckets and escalate privileges of a target IAM user account by exploiting misconfigurations in a user policy

6b780abb-47bd-4a81-b175-de2822304a36.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the ability to use cryptographic techniques to encrypt and conceal data. This includes generating hashes and checksums, using encryption and decryption techniques, creating certificates, and performing encryption on various data objects.
6b780abb-47bd-4a81-b175-de2822304a36.name: Certified Ethical Hacker - Cryptography

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the Certified Ethical Hacker - Cryptography and demonstrated the ability to use a variety of different encryption methods and how cryptography can be used to conceal data.

7a6ad872-b443-4ee3-a2b6-873cefa006d7.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated they are able to perform, detect, analyse, mitigate and defend Denial-of-Service (DoS) and Distributed Denial-of-Service (DDoS) attacks.
7a6ad872-b443-4ee3-a2b6-873cefa006d7.name: Certified Ethical Hacker - Denial of Service

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the Certified Ethical Hacker - Denial of Service lab and have demonstrated an excellent understanding of Denial-of-Service (DoS) and Distributed Denial-of-Service (DDoS) attacks including their execution, detection, mitigation and defence.

b10da850-c1a8-4d77-bf50-5351afbc4b7b.description: Earners of this badge successfully deployed a highly available Web application by using Bastion host to control the access to underlying private instances.
b10da850-c1a8-4d77-bf50-5351afbc4b7b.name: Deploying a Highly Available Web Application

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrated the creation of a Bastion Server and Security Group for the Load Balancer. Target groups & load balancers were created and Connected to the web server via Bastion to check high availability

438fb281-17f9-4654-96a8-2b66239f6f0d.description: Earners of this badge have gained skills and knowledge of IT operations, including networking, virtualization, identity, security, business continuity, disaster recovery, data platforms, and governance.
438fb281-17f9-4654-96a8-2b66239f6f0d.name: Designing Microsoft Azure Infrastructure Solutions

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the Designing Microsoft Azure Infrastructure Solutions learning path demonstrating an in-depth knowledge of IT operations in the Cloud and Microsoft Azure.

74384c47-11dd-4300-b390-30ba575ef5ba.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated how to export DynamoDB table items to an S3 Bucket in CSV format. Using DynamoDB table export, you can export data from an Amazon DynamoDB table at any time within your point-in-time recovery window to an Amazon S3 bucket.
74384c47-11dd-4300-b390-30ba575ef5ba.name: Export Data from DynamoDB

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrated knowledge of how to create an IAM role, S3, DynamoDB table, and Lambda function. Test and view the CSV file in the S3 bucket was part of it.

2897d7d8-5fd5-4d41-9a96-64047d16f2e5.description: Earners of this badge successfully simulated a corporate network in AWS itself. They created a VPC in the us-east region and launched an EC2 instance with Openswan which acted as a Public Router of the on-premises network.
2897d7d8-5fd5-4d41-9a96-64047d16f2e5.name: How to setup a free VPN server in AWS

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of the badge successfully demonstrated knowledge of the following topics; launching a lab environment, launching an EC2 instance, how to SSH into an EC2 instance, initializing a VPN server, connecting to a VPN and checking IP addresses.

d962d475-64a1-4bd0-9b92-ecde10b0bfc2.description: Earners of this badge have created an Azure Quantum Workspace and used a template Jupyter notebook with Qiskit.
d962d475-64a1-4bd0-9b92-ecde10b0bfc2.name: Jupyter Notebooks in Azure Quantum

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrated an understanding of how to set up an Azure Machine Learning Workspace and consequently make use of a Jupyter notebook and Qiskit.

d4be4d5e-af56-4331-89e6-3d5cbccbf9bf.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated knowledge of the RDS MySQL Database and learned how to migrate a snapshot of the database to Amazon Aurora.
d4be4d5e-af56-4331-89e6-3d5cbccbf9bf.name: Migration into Amazon Aurora

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrated knowledge of how to create an RDS MySQL Database and create a snapshot and Migrate to Aurora

c124bc8c-0c09-403f-8134-ee9b3e07fa65.description: Earners of this badge created three VPC’s with Internet Gateways, and EC2 instances - one per VPC. They observed that by default, EC2 instances in different VPCs are not able to communicate with each other using private IP addresses. They then used VPC peering and transit gateway to allow communication between the VPCs.
c124bc8c-0c09-403f-8134-ee9b3e07fa65.name: Scalable and secure multi-VPC architecture

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge demonstrated the ability to create VPCs, Subnets and EC2 Instances, to setup VPC peering and to setup transit gateway routing.

7f43737c-f1b6-4428-b9be-ce0856bc0ff5.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated knowledge of the following microservices: Azure Logic apps, Azure Service Bus, Azure Functions and Azure Blob Storage. They created a simple architecture that placed a message into an Azure Service Bus queue when a logic app is triggered by an HTTP request. An Azure function will then trigger when it detects a message in the Service Bus and upload a new file into Blob Storage.
7f43737c-f1b6-4428-b9be-ce0856bc0ff5.name: Service Bus Queue Microservice Architecture

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrated knowledge of how to create microservices such as Azure Logic apps, Azure Service Bus, Azure Functions and Azure Blob Storage and demonstrated knowledge of how to connect them together to create a simple architecture.

3138bf51-bd2a-483c-aef1-96966c443def.description: Earners of this badge created a user pool in Cognito and configured an application load balancer to authenticate using Cognito.
3138bf51-bd2a-483c-aef1-96966c443def.name: Creating cognito user pool in AWS

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge demonstrated ability to create a user pool in Cognito, they managed app integration settings, they configured AWS ALB to Authenticate using Cognito, and finally they opened go deploy through ALB authenticated using Cognito.

8c8fa2a9-9ba5-411d-9953-4ca4d2f7ce3e.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated knowledge of AWS console to create a Dual-stack VPC with two subnets and two EC2 instances, one in each subnet. Connectivity between two instances was tested by using IPv4.
8c8fa2a9-9ba5-411d-9953-4ca4d2f7ce3e.name: IPv6 Dual Stack VPC

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrated knowledge of how to create Network Infrastructure, configure Security Settings and create EC2 Instances, and Test Connectivity

6a8508e2-2a05-4406-be79-2cc4f36c8ed1.description: Earners of this badge created an EC2 instance, IAM role, and lambda function. Lambda function will be tested when they perform stop and terminate actions.
6a8508e2-2a05-4406-be79-2cc4f36c8ed1.name: Lambda function to shut down an EC2 instance

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge demonstrated the ability to create two EC2 instances, create an IAM role, create a lambda function, configure a test event, perform stop and terminate actions on EC2 instances, check the EC2 instances status, perform stop and terminate actions again and finally check the EC2 instance's status again.

8b46f495-38cc-4837-95f1-13521638561a.description: Earners of this badge learnt how to use AWS Systems Manager to remotely run commands on your Amazon EC2 instances.
8b46f495-38cc-4837-95f1-13521638561a.name: Remotely run commands on EC2 instance

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge demonstrated the ability to; create an Identity and Access Management (IAM) role, create an EC2 instance, update the systems manager agent, run a remote shell script and terminate their resources.

14c1d73c-248d-4aa7-a856-a0f2e2035cfd.description: Earners of this badge successfully utilized Terraform variables to make configuration more dynamic and flexible allowing for more reusable code. By utilising variables, the same Terraform code was reused to deploy similar resources in another configuration.
14c1d73c-248d-4aa7-a856-a0f2e2035cfd.name: Variables in Terraform configurations

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of the badge demonstrated knowledge of installing Terraform, configuring the Terraform providers, declaring input variables in Terraform, verifying configuration deployment and deleting created resources.

18da6d82-a3bb-49de-ae8d-afd650dc00a6.description: The earner of this badge demonstrated the ability to create and connect to an Amazon FSx for Windows file system with a Windows EC2 instances.
18da6d82-a3bb-49de-ae8d-afd650dc00a6.name: Amazon FSx

badge_template_activities.title: By achieving this badge this learner was able to demonstrate the ability to create an Active Directory Service for FSx. Additionally, they also were able deploy a Amazon FSx file system, two EC2 instances to access the FSx file system and map the FSx file share to the EC2 instances.

db43fa27-59ef-4bef-b6db-2aca66574d93.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated knowledge of AWS WorkSpaces to create a Windows 10 Desktop environment with an AWS Managed Microsoft AD directory.
db43fa27-59ef-4bef-b6db-2aca66574d93.name: Amazon WorkSpaces

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrated knowledge of how to create a directory, register the directory, install the Amazon WorkSpaces Client and launch the Amazon WorkSpaces Desktop environment

b89a4808-301d-4690-be79-31870e02b89b.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated knowledge of AWS Systems Manager to deploy Chef recipes to an EC2 instance using Run Command and State Manager.
b89a4808-301d-4690-be79-31870e02b89b.name: Apply Chef Recipes with AWS Systems Manager

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrated knowledge of how to upload Chef Recipe to EC2 Instances using AWS Systems Manager which is a popular configuration management tool used to configure Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) and on-premises instances

55051c83-9848-4f3d-9c50-2b5af9652564.description: Earners of this badge demonstrated a comprehensive understanding of AWS SysOps Administration. They demonstrated that they know how to operate, manage and deploy AWS systems with availability, high-scalability, and fault tolerance.
55051c83-9848-4f3d-9c50-2b5af9652564.name: AWS Certified SysOps Administrator

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge demonstrated ability in the following topics, monitoring, logging and remediation. They additionally showed understanding in topics such as reliability, business continuity, deployment, provisioning, automation, security and compliance, networking and content delivery, and cost and performance optimization.

47c6db15-0b1e-443b-b593-f82ccf5c8b3a.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated that they comprehensive understanding of AWS services and technologies. They know how to design, deploy, and manage workloads on AWS as well as implement appropriate security controls and compliance requirements.
47c6db15-0b1e-443b-b593-f82ccf5c8b3a.name: AWS Solutions Architect - Associate

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the AWS Solutions Architect Associate learning path and demonstrated a comprehensive understanding of AWS services and technologies.

db15dec8-aa81-49cf-9472-b709ecbb69f7.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated that they an extensive understanding of designing technical strategies to accomplish specific business goals. They know how to evaluate cloud application requirements and make architectural recommendations for implementation, deployment, and provisioning applications on AWS.
db15dec8-aa81-49cf-9472-b709ecbb69f7.name: AWS Solutions Architect - Professional

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the AWS Solutions Architect Professional learning path and demonstrated an extensive understanding of designing technical strategies to accomplish specific business goals.

e1f34ff2-4deb-40f7-a40b-27c3b9340ad0.description: APIs enable digital experiences, simplify application integration, underpin new digital products, and make data and services reusable and universally accessible. Azure API Management is a is a way to create consistent and modern API gateways for existing back-end services.
e1f34ff2-4deb-40f7-a40b-27c3b9340ad0.name: Azure API Management

badge_template_activities.title: API Management basics including Creating your own API; Protecting your API and adding revisions and versions to your API.

bae1719d-7412-48bc-b7ef-cd25606734a5.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the ability to create a cluster, and create one or more databases in the cluster. They ingested data into a database so that they could run queries against it.
bae1719d-7412-48bc-b7ef-cd25606734a5.name: Azure Data Explorer

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrated the ability to create an Azure Data Explorer cluster and run basic database commands. They also demonstrated the ability to ingest data into the cluster and then query the data using SQL-like statements.

72ff19fe-ecda-484a-bd10-7ea42f2b5712.description: The learner was able to acquire the required skills to integrate an Azure function with different Azure services using input and output bindings. They were also able read from and write to data sources using these input and output bindings.
72ff19fe-ecda-484a-bd10-7ea42f2b5712.name: Azure Functions using Input and Output Bindings

badge_template_activities.title: Create a sample function, explored what input, and output bindings were available. Reading and writing data to a Cosmos DB database and Azure queue storage using output bindings

ed0b095a-d1c0-48cf-ba4a-719197b1f9d4.description: Earners of the badge created a simple serverless web application utilising AWS Lambda, Amazon API Gateway, AWS Amplify, DynamoDB and Amazon Cognito.
ed0b095a-d1c0-48cf-ba4a-719197b1f9d4.name: Building a serverless web application

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge demonstrated the ability to host a Static Website, manage users, build a serverless backend and deploy a serverless RESTful API.

4891cf4f-e4c6-4493-988a-1a292da4fbc7.description: Earners of this badge will have demonstrated the ability to build a project in the cloud using AWS Cloud9 and AWS Codebuild. AWS Cloud9 is a cloud-based integrated development environment (IDE) that lets you write, run, and debug your code with just a browser. Cloud9 comes pre-packaged with essential tools for popular programming languages and the AWS Command Line Interface (CLI) pre-installed so you don't need to install files or configure your laptop for this workshop.
4891cf4f-e4c6-4493-988a-1a292da4fbc7.name: Building Code using AWS Cloud 9 & Codebuild

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge demonstrated knowledge of, setting up a Cloud9 IDE, cloning repositories, committing changes to the repository and creating a Codebuild project from the CLI.

ee1a6ebd-a456-44ae-b04c-8b7a2f421346.description: Earners of this badge learned the latest commercial-grade hacking tools, techniques, and methodologies used by hackers and information security professionals to lawfully hack an organization.
ee1a6ebd-a456-44ae-b04c-8b7a2f421346.name: Certified Ethical Hacker

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrated ethical hacking skills by performing scanning networks, vulnerability analysis, sniffing, social engineering, SQL injection, IoT & OT hacking, session hijacking, and hacking wireless networks.

2f6cb33e-15cb-4ff2-87fd-ac8ae83f7409.description: Earners of this have demonstrated a comprehensive understanding of the tools, technologies and techniques required to defend and strengthen a network against several types of networks related cyber-attacks.
2f6cb33e-15cb-4ff2-87fd-ac8ae83f7409.name: Certified Network Defender

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the Certified Network Defender learning path demonstrating an ability to identify, defend, secure and mitigate network related cyber-attacks.

e75692c9-6c10-4a33-90bf-1f164ad3cf12.description: By achieving this badge, the learner was able to demonstrate their ability to set up a recording configuration setting for AWS Config. This allowed them to detect unprotected security groups in an account.
e75692c9-6c10-4a33-90bf-1f164ad3cf12.name: Check Compliance Status of Security Group

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge demonstrated knowledge in the following topics: launching a lab environment; setting up config with 1 click option; creating a config rule; creating their first and second security group and testing the compliance status of the security groups.

87cd55da-e586-4b41-ac0b-b24fabb2b5c1.description: Earners of this badge demonstrated the ability to build a simple AWS architecture using Infrastructure as Code. They learnt how to construct a CloudFormation template from scratch using YAML.
87cd55da-e586-4b41-ac0b-b24fabb2b5c1.name: CloudFormation templates using YAML

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge demonstrated the ability to create the following using a CloudFormation template; VPC, internet gateway, route table, security group and EC2 instances. They also demonstrated the ability to deploy infrastructure, verify stack deployment and delete a stack.

57bd3717-091e-4425-a1d5-cb426b926564.description: This learner earned this badge by complete the lab "CloudFormation templates using YAML".
57bd3717-091e-4425-a1d5-cb426b926564.name: CloudFormation templates using YAML badge

badge_template_activities.title: This learner earned this badge by complete the lab "CloudFormation templates using YAML".

c9264f75-b359-410d-a2a4-f7be5f82d9da.description: Earners of this badge demonstrated the ability to create, configure and update a Cloud NAT using the GCP.
c9264f75-b359-410d-a2a4-f7be5f82d9da.name: Cloud NAT

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge demonstrated the ability to set up a Cloud NAT gateway in preparation for NAT Rules, using Common Expression Language (CEL), They also demonstrated their ability to create NAT Rules which they attached to a NAT Gateway. They also tested NAT Rules from an instance.

070a32b7-2fbc-4b0b-936d-9be9ed069b9c.description: By achieving this badge, this learner has the necessary skills to proactively investigate complex security threats, allowing them to investigate, record, and report cybercrimes to prevent future attacks.
070a32b7-2fbc-4b0b-936d-9be9ed069b9c.name: Computer Hacking Forensics Investigator

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the Computer Hacking Forensics Investigator learning path and demonstrated the ability to carry out forensic investigations by recording and reporting cyber security threats to prevent future attacks.

bf9b1e3b-c69c-42b8-8e02-71a91d6b8a23.description: Earners of this badge successfully used Ansible to automatically setup an Apache web server on multiple EC2 instances in AWS.
bf9b1e3b-c69c-42b8-8e02-71a91d6b8a23.name: Configuring EC2 Instances with Ansible

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrated knowledge of how to configure EC2 instances with Ansible by using push configuration.

cb7bd738-08cf-4365-8fa0-eff529d02ab1.description: Earners of this badge successfully created a serverless workflow with step functions and Lambda to automate the handling of support tickets in a call center
cb7bd738-08cf-4365-8fa0-eff529d02ab1.name: Create Serverless Workflow

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrating the creation of State Machine & Serverless Workflow and creation of lambda function and execute the workflow.

c751da2a-5e62-4054-a6d7-8a2663cecee9.description: Earners of this badge demonstrated the ability to use the the Amazon Lex V2 console to create a bot for a banking application that can that can handle the following requests: Check account balances, make bill payments, and transfer funds.
c751da2a-5e62-4054-a6d7-8a2663cecee9.name: Creating a BankingBot with Support for English

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge demonstrated the ability to create a bot and add language support, add a lambda function to fulfil user requests and configure a bot for English (US).

176f323f-aa5f-4ac4-9fcb-fc4559e420cf.description: Earners of this badge demonstrated the ability to create a highly available web application spanning multiple availability zone complete with a load balancer and an auto-scaling group. High availability describes systems that are able to operate continuously without failure. Highly available architectures ensure that there are no single points of failure that could affect business critical systems.
176f323f-aa5f-4ac4-9fcb-fc4559e420cf.name: Creating a Highly Available Web Application

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge demonstrated knowledge of creating a Virtual Private Cloud, creating web servers, creating a load balancer and creating an auto scaling group.

6994102c-d765-487f-a1b3-cddcca79adee.description: Earners of this badge created a site-to-site virtual private network (VPN) between a private on-premises datacenter and the cloud. They simulated the corporate branch office using a second AWS VPC, installed and configured a software-based VPN gateway running on an EC2 instance. They created a virtual private gateway and customer gateway inside of AWS to configure an IPsec tunnel between the two sites.
6994102c-d765-487f-a1b3-cddcca79adee.name: Creating an AWS site to site (S2S) VPN

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge demonstrated the ability to create a network configuration, to create EC2 instances and to create a Virtual Private Network (VPN).

41878b11-6df9-452b-8ad9-56a12a2b5128.description: Earners of this badge learnt how use Amazon Fraud Detector to build, train and deploy a fraud detection model. Amazon Fraud Detector uses machine learning (ML) and 20 years of fraud detection expertise from Amazon Web Services (AWS) and Amazon.com to automatically identify potential fraudulent activity in milliseconds.
41878b11-6df9-452b-8ad9-56a12a2b5128.name: Deploy a fraud detection model

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge demonstrated knowledge of how to create an S3 bucket to upload the training dataset, how to create an event for the Fraud Detector and how to train and deploy the fraud detection model.

4875f6b3-5252-4e37-9c88-77541c82e6f3.description: The learner was able to learn the skills required to work with Bicep and Bicep templates to deploy and manage resources in Microsoft Azure.
4875f6b3-5252-4e37-9c88-77541c82e6f3.name: Deploy and Manage Resources in Azure Bicep

badge_template_activities.title: Create your first basic Bicep template that utilises parameters, constraints, and loops.

3adab14c-51f1-4af6-b5a1-d38332cf6a2c.description: The learner was able to create and configure a new Azure Spring Cloud cluster and Spring Cloud Config Server Configure distributed tracing to debug a microservices architecture
3adab14c-51f1-4af6-b5a1-d38332cf6a2c.name: Deploy Spring Microservices to Azure

badge_template_activities.title: Create and configure a new Azure Spring Cloud cluster and Spring Cloud Config Server Configure distributed tracing to debug a microservices architecture

8710e015-491b-42be-9283-04b461081eae.description: The learner was able acquire the appropriate skills required to create and configure Amazon Macie job to discover sensitive data within an AWS S3 bucket.
8710e015-491b-42be-9283-04b461081eae.name: Discover Sensitive Data using Amazon Macie

badge_template_activities.title: Create an S3 bucket and upload a test file and setup Amazon Macie and view findings.

23930d6c-db7b-43a5-bd73-924136d9bd3c.description: Earners of this badge demonstrated their ability to deploy Docker containers using the Google Cloud Platform.
23930d6c-db7b-43a5-bd73-924136d9bd3c.name: Docker with GCP

badge_template_activities.title: The learner demonstrated the ability to deploy Docker containers. They were also able to build Docker containers and pull Docker images from Docker Hub.

8c1651a1-1d6b-49ba-929f-e6ee019130bd.description: Earners of this badge have defined a simple stateful workflow by writing orchestrator functions and entity functions using the Azure Functions programming model in Visual Studio Code to create their first durable function - a simple "Hello orchestration" using the Function chaining pattern.
8c1651a1-1d6b-49ba-929f-e6ee019130bd.name: Durable Functions in Azure

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrating the ability to set up a local Azure Functions project, creating a simple "Hello orchestration", testing the function and finally the ability to publish the function into Azure.

3ab269dc-f808-4702-8429-ef98daf6d4e3.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the ability to make use of Databricks Data Science. They extracted data from Data Lake Storage, transformed this data in Azure Databricks and loaded the transformed data into Azure Synapse Analytics so they could view the data in SQL Server Management Studio.
3ab269dc-f808-4702-8429-ef98daf6d4e3.name: ETL Operations with Databricks

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrated knowledge of how to create an Azure Syanpse, different kinds of Storage Accounts and the Databricks service. Knowledge of performing ETL operations in Databricks was required.

dd8a8a10-adce-4705-9665-300521a41111.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated knowledge of the following microservices: Azure Event Grid, Azure Service Bus, Azure Functions and Azure Blob Storage. They created a simple architecture that placed a message into an Azure Service Bus queue when a file was uploaded into Blob Storage via an Event Grid subscription. An Azure function then triggers when it detected a message in the Service Bus and uploaded a new file into Blob Storage.
dd8a8a10-adce-4705-9665-300521a41111.name: Event Grid Microservice Architecture

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrated knowledge of how to create microservices such as Azure Event Grid, Azure Service Bus, Azure Functions and Azure Blob Storage and demonstrated knowledge of how to connect them together to create a simple architecture.

00bc52d8-9d75-41a1-bf64-fc218a230150.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated a fundamental understanding of Docker. They know how to use Docker to separate applications from infrastructure to deliver software quickly.
00bc52d8-9d75-41a1-bf64-fc218a230150.name: Get Started with Docker

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the Get Started with Docker learning path and demonstrated a fundamental understanding of Docker.

ce56ea50-73c4-4ae0-bbb2-3b03fbe45138.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated an understanding of the basic concepts, skills and use cases associated with HashiCorp Terraform. They understand how to deploy and manage resources using Terraform and Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
ce56ea50-73c4-4ae0-bbb2-3b03fbe45138.name: HashiCorp Certified: Terraform Associate

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the HashiCorp Certified: Terraform Associate learning path and demonstrated an understanding of the basic concepts, skills and use cases for Terraform.

5e9b697f-bfad-44d1-8dbc-377bbb3be42a.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated a fundamental understanding of programming with Go. They are able to create simple and clean code using variables, arrays, maps and functions with Go.
5e9b697f-bfad-44d1-8dbc-377bbb3be42a.name: Introduction to Go

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the Introduction to Go learning path and demonstrated a fundamental understanding of programming with Go.

1538b80e-8ce9-4f26-839f-798b97d21e21.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated a foundational understanding of the R programming language including using variables, strings, vectors, matrices, lists, arrays, and data frames.
1538b80e-8ce9-4f26-839f-798b97d21e21.name: Introduction to R

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the Introduction to R learning path and demonstrated a foundational understanding of the R programming language.

85804df8-cbd7-4f31-a2b8-41e13b988aa5.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated knowledge of Puppet server and agent on EC2 instances to automatically create an Apache webserver.
85804df8-cbd7-4f31-a2b8-41e13b988aa5.name: Manage AWS Resources with Puppet

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrated knowledge of how to configure apache with Puppet. The puppet gets installed on both Master and Agent servers and its Puppet master gets control of the agent machine. Where any changes of the agent server can be done from Puppet master without accessing the Puppet agent. Puppet helps in an environment where you want to make the same changes across multiple different agents.

1810b585-58af-438b-8235-3a9a68d17190.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated a foundational understanding of Cloud computing and foundational knowledge of Microsoft Azure services.
1810b585-58af-438b-8235-3a9a68d17190.name: Microsoft Azure Foundationals

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the Microsoft Azure Foundationals learning path demonstrating a core understanding and ability to work with Microsoft Azure.

9c4183b4-6592-4d26-8e1b-e330287e8029.description: Earners of this badge have trained an image detection model on a sample of images using the Custom Vision website. The model they trained is able to detect and label images.
9c4183b4-6592-4d26-8e1b-e330287e8029.name: Object Detection with Azure Custom Vision

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrated the ability to create a Custom Vision resource in Azure, and consequently create a new project on the Custom Vision website and then train a model to detect and label images.

05451d1f-c97f-442c-a9be-f2e77d5a96b4.description: Earners of this badge demonstrated the ability to provision a Bonsai workspace and train two different brains to balance a ball and then a cartpole, measuring the performance of the brains.
05451d1f-c97f-442c-a9be-f2e77d5a96b4.name: Project Bonsai

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrated the ability to provision a Bonsai Workspace, and successfully train a Bonsai Brain so that it can balance a cartpole and ball

45dc7457-1447-405c-ac97-19699f29b280.description: The learner developed skills to implement infrastructure as code for Azure solutions using Azure Resource Manager templates (ARM templates). The template was a JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) file that defines the infrastructure and configuration for your project. The template uses declarative syntax, which let the learner state what they intend to deploy without having to write the sequence of programming commands to create it.
45dc7457-1447-405c-ac97-19699f29b280.name: Provision Resources using ARM templates

badge_template_activities.title: Creating an ARM template containing resources, parameters, functions, and variables. Adding an output to the ARM template and continuously deploy, test and verify the template.

98cb2185-b14c-46d4-9c2e-0f6d5e7df73c.description: The learner was able to create a regression model using Azure machine learning designer. This is a no-code solution, and you will use the drag and drop features of Azure machine learning designer to create the machine learning pipeline.
98cb2185-b14c-46d4-9c2e-0f6d5e7df73c.name: Regression with Azure Machine Learning Designer

badge_template_activities.title: Create a new pipeline, Import the data, Prepare, and transform the data. Train the machine learning model using a linear regression algorithm.

19722e5d-aef7-4683-b078-c4b339a07b72.description: The learner was able to create a cartpole and a virtual environment that will obey the laws of physics. Then they created a reinforcement learning model that will train the agent (cartpole) to be able to balance vertically in its environment.
19722e5d-aef7-4683-b078-c4b339a07b72.name: Reinforcement Learning Model using Python

badge_template_activities.title: Create and connect to an Azure VM to Install Matplotlib, Gym and NumPy Python libraries. Set up your gym environment to create and train your reinforcement model.

d54fb620-49b1-4285-912e-a626a25c026e.description: The learner was able to learn and demonstrate the skill required to create and configure Amazon Inspector assessment using ab EC2 instance to identify security vulnerabilities.
d54fb620-49b1-4285-912e-a626a25c026e.name: Security Vulnerabilities with Amazon Inspector

badge_template_activities.title: Launch an EC2 instance followed by Configure Amazon Inspector assessment. Finally Rectify security vulnerabilities

d98cd789-32d4-4333-9963-c868de6cb666.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated knowledge of the following microservices: Azure Logic apps, Azure Service Bus, Azure Functions and Azure Blob Storage. They created a simple architecture that placed a message into an Azure Service Bus topic when a logic app was triggered by an HTTP request. For each topic subscription an Azure function then triggers when it detected a message in the Service Bus topic and uploaded a new file into Blob Storage.
d98cd789-32d4-4333-9963-c868de6cb666.name: Service Bus Topics Microservice Architecture

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrated knowledge of how to create microservices such as Azure Logic apps, Azure Service Bus, Azure Functions and Azure Blob Storage and demonstrated knowledge of how to connect them together to create a simple architecture.

8e4f00c1-61c4-4323-a124-015fd517bd45.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the ability to create and use relational databases with SQL. They understand how to create databases and tables as well as input, modify and query data.
8e4f00c1-61c4-4323-a124-015fd517bd45.name: SQL: Create and use a Relational Database

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the SQL: Create and use a Relational Database learning path and demonstrated an understanding of creating databases and tables as well as input, modify and query data.

8e463ba5-82e2-4330-89c6-40c789d98ad6.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated knowledge of the following microservices: Azure Logic Apps, Azure Storage Queue, Azure Functions and Azure Blob Storage. They created a simple architecture that placed a message into an Azure Storage Queue when a logic app received an HTTP request. An Azure function then triggered when it detected a message in the Storage Queue and uploaded a new file into Blob Storage.
8e463ba5-82e2-4330-89c6-40c789d98ad6.name: Storage Queue Microservice Architecture

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrated knowledge of how to create microservices such as Azure Logic Apps, Azure Storage Queue, Azure Functions and Azure Blob Storage and demonstrated knowledge of how to connect them together to create a simple architecture.

7993b49b-7184-4056-a541-79ca4837979f.description: The earner of this badge was able to learn skills required to create a time-series forecasting model to predict the price of renting a bike depending on a large amount of supplementary information using Azure Automated ML
7993b49b-7184-4056-a541-79ca4837979f.name: Time-Series Forecasting Model with Azure

badge_template_activities.title: Create an Azure Machine Learning workspace and the dataset Configure and deploy the Automated ML run.

943043e3-aa37-4bc0-b100-cf7f36043a65.description: Earners of this badge have created a workflow that can successfully perform sentiment analysis on Twitter activity.
943043e3-aa37-4bc0-b100-cf7f36043a65.name: Twitter Sentiment Analysis Workflow

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrated the ability to use Azure functions, Logic Apps and Language Service resource in order to perform sentiment detection as part of a workflow.
